page.title: 11WINCHAM COMMUNITY CENTRE.
page.content: In 1977, Jubilee Year, a committee was formed in Wincham to organize local celebrations. After the event, the committee decided to stay together to build a Community Centre. They worked out a plan of campaign in three parts: researching regulations and grants, designing the proposed building and fund-raising. A piece of land next to the Primary School was leased from the County Council and building was begun in 1980. The main structure was erected by a local building firm, but the roof and interior were completed by voluntary labour. The Centre was formally opened in 1983 and won the first ever Cheshire Community Council Award. It is now thriving, with many enthusiastic user-groups, ranging from Mother/Toddler groups to Computer Clubs. The major user is the School, which rents it every day of the week.
